definitions: To raise or tilt (the head or an ear) in a particular direction, typically to listen or show interest.
To prepare (a firearm) for firing by pulling back the hammer or bolt.
To set (a tap or valve) to allow flow.
To turn up or raise (a hat or other item of clothing) at an angle.
examples: The dog cocks its head when it hears a strange noise.
He cocks the rifle before aiming.
She cocks the tap to fill the bucket.
He cocks his hat at a jaunty angle.
